contentrichtext.text: '''Pionium''' is an [[exotic atom]] consisting of one {{SubatomicParticle|link=yes|Pion+}} and one {{SubatomicParticle|link=yes|Pion-}} [[meson]]. It can be created, for instance, by interaction of a [[proton]] beam accelerated by a [[particle accelerator]] and a target [[atomic nucleus|nucleus]]. Pionium has a short lifetime, predicted by [[Chirality (physics)|chiral]] [[perturbation theory (quantum mechanics)|perturbation theory]] to be {{val|2.89|e=-15|u=s}}. It decays mainly into two {{SubatomicParticle|link=yes|Pion0}} [[mesons]], and to a smaller extent into two photons. Pionium is currently under investigation at [[CERN]] to measure its lifetime. The [[DIRAC]] collaboration was able to detect more than 5000 pionium decays from a total of {{val|6.4|e=8}} events, which will allow the lifetime to be determined to within statistical errors of 15%. The team hopes to reduce this error to 10% in the future.<ref name=hep-ph/9808407> {{cite arxiv |last1=Schacher |first1=J. |year=1998 |title=DIRAC Experiment at CERN: Lifetime Measurement of Pionium |class=hep-ph |eprint=hep-ph/9808407 }}</ref> In 2005, the [[NA48 experiment|NA48/2 collaboration]] at CERN published an evidence for pionium production and decay in decays of charged [[kaon]]s, studying mass spectra of daughter [[pion]] pairs in the events with three pions in the final state: <math>K^\pm\to\pi^\pm(\pi\pi)_{atom}\to\pi^\pm\pi^0\pi^0</math>.<ref name=hep-ex/0511056> {{cite journal |last1=Batley|first1=J. R. |coauthors=''et al.'' (NA48/2 Collaboration) |title=Observation of a cusp-like structure in the ''π''<sup>0</sup>''π''<sup>0</sup> invariant mass distribution from ''K''<sup>±</sup> → ''π''<sup>±</sup>''π''<sup>0</sup>''π''<sup>0</sup> decay and determination of the ππ scattering lengths |year=2005 |journal=[[Physics Letters B]] |volume=633 |issue=2–3 |pages=173–182 |arxiv=hep-ex/0511056 |bibcode=2006PhLB..633..173N |doi=10.1016/j.physletb.2005.11.087 }}</ref> The possibility to measure pionium characteristics is being investigated.<ref name=hep-ex/0510004> {{cite arxiv |last1=Madigozhin |first=D. |year=2005 |title=Pion scattering lengths from NA48 |class=hep-ex |eprint=hep-ex/0510004 }}</ref> The results of the above experiments will provide crucial tests of low-energy [[Quantum chromodynamics|QCD]] predictions.<ref name="urlA Monte Carlo calculation of the pionium break-up probability"> {{cite journal |last1=Santamarina |first1=C. |last2=Schumann |first2=M. |last3=Afanasyev |first3=L.
